content: the very first thing to do is to take out the white stopper that which switches the light off/ you now need to secure the stopper against the nut so that it won t pull out on from the balloon light and very carefully make a hole in the centre of the widest round completely when the acorn is complete so work stitches around the top of bit the narrower part of the stopper is the part that you ll insert into the light the nut at the same time joining the top of the nut to the covered part of the * i started with a tiny pin hole and then enlarged it with a yarn-sewing needle sized hole - stopper you should still be able to access the stopper be able to gently pull ref fig 1 it partially out and push back in again to switch the light on and off when you ve done that take a threaded-up yarn needle threaded-up with the yarn that - ref fig 4 you re going to be knitting the acorn cap with yarn b and work through the hole and around the top part of the white stopper to cover just the top part insert the bottom of the stopper into the balloon light to switch the light off and put it to one side - ref fig 2 nut - in the round beginning at the top of the nut with yarn a and two dpns cast on 6 sts row 1 increase kfb six times 12sts divide all 12 sts evenly over three dpns and with a fourth needle continue to work in the round as follows round 1 increase k1 kfb k2 three times kfb k1 16sts fig 1 fig 2 rnds 2-9 work eight rounds stocking stitch knit every round place a marker to mark the beginning of the round moving the marker for each round round 10 decrease k1 k2tog k2 three times k2tog k1 12sts cut yarn thread end through all 12 nut base sts as you slip the stitches off the knitting needles insert the balloon light into the nut making sure the yarn-covered stopper is clearly accessible at the top/ cast-on end of the nut - ref fig 3 add a tiny blob of glue to the bottom of the balloon light pull the yarn at the nut base up tightly to gather to close the hole around the glued end of the balloon light adhering the centre of the bottom of the acorn at the same time secure the tail end check the glue is dry before continuing fig 3 fig 4 acorn lantern page 6 acorn lantern page 7 cap - in the round beginning at the edge of the cap with yarn b and two dpns cast on 18 sts divide all 18 sts evenly over three dpns and with a fourth needle continue to work in the round as follows rnds 1-7 work seven rounds stocking stitch
